ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Study stage
Notes: 0 = Pre-Randomization (TADS) 1 = Stage 1 (TADS) 2 = Stage 2 (TADS) 3 = Stage 3 (TADS) 4 = Stage 4 (TADS) 5 = Stage 5 (SOFTAD); 51=Treatmentas Usual; 52=Screening Alone; 53=Intervention; 67=Unknown; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: Weeks from Time 0 (randomization) to Gate A Screening Form date
Weeks from Time 0 (randomization) to Gate B1 Procedures date
Weeks from Time 0 (randomization) to Gate B2 Procedures date
Weeks from Time 0 (randomization) to Gate C1 Procedures date
Weeks from Time 0 (randomization) to Gate C2 Orientation visit date
Weeks from Time 0 (randomization) to First Treatment visit date
Time between Gate A and B1 (days)
Time between Gate B1 and C1 (days)
Time between Gate C1 and C2 (days)
Source of recruitment: Advertisement for the TADS trial
Source of recruitment: General advertisement for depression studies
Source of recruitment: Internal referral
Source of recruitment: External mental health professional referral
Source of recruitment: External medical, but non- mental health, professional referral
Source of recruitment: External non-medical professional referral
Source of recruitment: Personal referral
Source of recruitment: NIMH Web site / other Internet source
Source of recruitment: School personnel
Source of recruitment: Other
Source of recruitment was self-referral or other personal referral
Final eligibility status
Notes: 1 = Excluded during Gate A phone screen 2    = Excluded during the Gate B1 or B2  procedures 3 = Excluded during the Gate C1 assessment procedures 4 = Discontinued participation between Gates A and B 5 = Discontinued participation between Gates B and C1 6 = Discontinued participation between Gates C1 and C2 7 = Eligible, enrolled, did not attend first treatment session 8 = Eligible, enrolled, first treatment session initiated

ElementDescription: ADD/ADHD History: Does the patient have a previous diagnosis of ADD/ADHD? (Gates A and B)
ADD/ADHD History: Has the patient ever received treatment for ADD/ADHD? (Gates A and B)
ADD/ADHD History: Is the patient currently taking a non-prohibited psychostimulant for ADD/ADHD? (Gates A and B)
ADD/ADHD Psychostimulant Inclusion criteria: Has the patient been on a stable dose of a non-prohibited psychostimulant during the 12 months preceding Gate B? (Gates A and B)

ADD/ADHD Psychostimulant Inclusion criteria: If the patient is currently taking a non-prohibited psychostimulant for ADD/ADHD, has a written agreement to abide by the TADS protocol been obtained from the patients prescribing physician? (Gate C1)
Gate A eligible (entered the Gate)
Gate B eligible (entered the Gate)
Gate C1 eligible (entered the Gate)
Gate C2 eligible (entered the Gate)
Patient did not meet all eligibility requirements but a waiver was granted during the caseness panel review
Inclusion criteria EC1: Is the patient at least in the 6th grade and at most in the 12th grade at the time of written informed consent?
Inclusion criteria EC2: Is the patient between 12-17 years of age at the time of written informed consent?
Inclusion criteria EC3: Has the patient resided with his/her primary caretaker for at least 6 months?
Inclusion criteria EC4: Is the patients full-scale IQ ?80?
Inclusion criteria EC5: Does the patient reside in a home with a functional telephone?
Inclusion criteria EC6: Other than permitted psychostimulants, has the patient been psychotropic medication-free for at least two weeks at the time of written informed consent?
Inclusion criteria EC7: Have the parent and patient provided written informed consent/assent?
Inclusion criteria EC8: Does the patient have a DSM- IV diagnosis of current MDD?
Inclusion criteria EC9: Is the diagnosis of MDD stable and pervasive?
Inclusion criteria EC10: Is the patients CDRS-R summary score ? 45 at baseline?
Exclusion criteria EC11: Does the patient have a sibling that was previously enrolled in this study?
Exclusion criteria EC12: Is the patient non-English speaking?
Exclusion criteria EC13: Is the primary caretaker non-English speaking?
Exclusion criteria EC14: Is the patient pregnant or breast-feeding?
Exclusion criteria EC15: Has the patient missed more than 25% of school days in the preceding two months?
Exclusion criteria EC16: Has the patient been previously enrolled in TADS or another depression treatment study?
Exclusion criteria EC17: Has the patient participated in a depression assessment study in the past 3 months?
Exclusion criteria EC18: Is the patient currently receiving neuroleptic treatment?
Exclusion criteria EC19: Has the patient been hospitalized for any psychiatric indications in the past 3 months?
Exclusion criteria EC20: Has the patient required chronic neuroleptic treatment in the 6 months prior to Gate C2?
Exclusion criteria EC21: Is the patient currently taking a psychotropic medication that is on the episodic or chronic prohibited list?
Exclusion criteria EC22: Is the patient currently taking a prohibited psychostimulant?
Exclusion criteria EC23: Does the patient have a major neurologic disorder that requires a prohibited medication and/or would interfere with participation in the study?
Exclusion criteria EC24: Does the patient have a medical condition that requires a prohibited medication and/or would interfere with study participation?
Exclusion criteria EC25: Has the patient failed a previous trial of fluoxetine judged adequate in dose and duration?
Exclusion criteria EC26: Does the patient have a history of intolerance to fluoxetine?
Exclusion criteria EC27: Has the patient failed 2 previous SSRI trials judged adequate in dose and duration?
Exclusion criteria EC28: Has the patient failed a trial of CBT for depression within the previous 2 years judged adequate by at least 12 treatment sessions over a period of less than 1 year?
Exclusion criteria EC29: Does the patient have a history of violent or criminal behavior resulting in current legal sanctions?
Exclusion criteria EC30: Does the patient pose a significant suicidal or homicidal risk?
Exclusion criteria EC31: Is the patient a victim of ongoing or previously undisclosed child abuse requiring a new DSS report or ongoing DSS supervision?
Exclusion criteria EC32: Does the patient meet past or current DSM-IV criteria for bipolar affective disorder?
Exclusion criteria EC33: Does the patient meet DSM-IV criteria for OCD and the disorder is severe enough to require OCD-specific treatment?
Exclusion criteria EC34: Does the patient meet DSM-IV criteria for primary conduct disorder or haveconduct problems that may affect the patients ability to comply with the study procedures?
Exclusion criteria EC35: Does the patient meet DSM-IV criteria for autism, PDD, or Aspergers syndrome?

Exclusion criteria EC36: Does the patient have a past or current diagnosis of psychotic disorder, including schizophrenia-spectrum disorder, psychotic major depression, or an organic psychotic disorder?
Exclusion criteria EC37: Does the patient meet DSM-IV criteria for a primary or co-primary substance abuse or dependence disorder?
Exclusion criteria EC38: Does the patient meet DSM-IV criteria for ongoing opiate or hallucinogen use?
Patient did not meet all eligibility requirements but a waiver was granted during the caseness panel review (not counting EC15)
